description: From a series of five lithographs for Der Lebende Leichnam (The Living Corpse) by Leo Tolstoy, published by Karl Lang Verlag in Darmstadt, 1919; housed in a beige portfolio case with a gray binding; a distressed looking figure sits behind a table with arms outstretched; one hand grasps the edge of the table and the other hand pushes into the table with an upright palm
inscription: LRC in plate: P.W.G. / 19. | LL in pencil, below image: 3)
portfolio: From Plate 3 from Der Lebende Leichnam (The Living Corpse), Leo Tolstoy, published by Karl Lang Verlag in Darmstadt, 1919
signed: LR in pencil, below image: Walter Gramatté
title: Fedja Plays with the Idea of Suicide for the First Time, Plate 3 from Der Lebende Leichnam (The Living Corpse)
